result.execSummary:
The defendant Tarron D Garner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tarron D Garner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (16 pages) commencing 08/27/2014 SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT received and filed.

Defendant Tarron D Garner in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Tarron D Garner in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 64 MONTHS, CONCURRENT with any other sentence, with credit for 142 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 28 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Restitution to be paid first.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Restitution in the amount of $116.00 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Program. 
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS, SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
-No contact with victim or any child under the age of 16, unless approved by agent.
-Follow any and all conditions of Department of Corrections

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
Defendant is remanded and is to report to Dodge Correctional.

Filed: 
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Tarron D Garner in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Tarron D Garner in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Defense will be having a private presentence prepared.  Court remands defendant and adjourns sentencing to 8-27-2014 at 8:15am.

Defendant Tarron D Garner in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Tarron D Garner in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Crime Lab report has not been completed yet; preliminary analysis is done.  Counsels are requesting another plea and sentencing date about 3 weeks out.  Case is adjourned to 7-10-2014 at 8:15am.

Attorney Scott F Anderson in court, defendant Tarron D Garner not in court, in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are still waiting for DNA results.  Defense is requesting a projected plea date.  Case is adjourned to 6-19-2014 at 8:15 for plea.

Defendant Tarron D Garner in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Tarron D Garner in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TM and Latosha D. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tarron D Garner in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Tarron D Garner in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
